DOC.brief_summary: Metabolic syndrome ( MS ) significant risk factor cardiovascular disease . However , relationship coenzyme Q10 , antioxidant vitamin ( Vitamin A , C , E ) prevention risk MS still inconsistent . The purpose study go investigate relation coenzyme Q10 , antioxidant vitamin concentration blood lipid level , marker lipid peroxidation ( TBARS ) , antioxidant enzyme activity ( catalase , glutathione peroxidase superoxide dismutase ) , inflammatory marker ( hs-CRP , IL-6 adiponectin ) . The investigator recruit MS patient ( case group , n = 100 ) age-gender match healthy subject previous study ( n = 105 ) control group . The inclusion criterion MS accord Bureau Health Promotion , Department Health Taiwan ( 2007 ) .Hopefully , result study could provide information know MS subject . The investigator expect coenzyme Q10 antioxidant vitamin could preventive supplement reduce risk MS .
DOC.brief_title: Coenzyme Q10 Vitamin A , C , E Relation Oxidative Stress , Antioxidant Enzyme Activity Inflammation Subjects With Metabolic Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Metabolic syndrome Healthy individual normal blood biochemical value . Age < 18y Antioxidant vitamin supplement use Pregnant woman
